heading: passage: red norvo, 91
subheading: the man who introduced the xylophone and vibraphone to jazz in the 1920s died this week at a santa monica retirement home. red norvo played with jazz legends like benny goodman, charlie parker, dizzie gillespie, charles mingus, and billie holliday. norvo was 14 when he started playing the marimba. he graduated to the xylophone and later the vibraphone. he died on tuesday, and no cause of death was given.
author: wired staff
text: the man who introduced the xylophone and vibraphone to jazz in the 1920s died this week at a santa monica retirement home. red norvo played with jazz legends like benny goodman, charlie parker, dizzie gillespie, charles mingus, and billie holliday. norvo was 14 when he started playing the marimba. he graduated to the xylophone and later the vibraphone. he died on tuesday, and no cause of death was given.
